Mergerstat M & A Database



TARGET: Yahoo!, Inc. 
BUYER: Microsoft Corp. 
SELLER: Yahoo!, Inc.



LAST UPDATE: April 24, 2009 
ANNOUNCE DATE: February 1, 2008



DEAL NO.: 457498


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Public Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Cancelled Date:

May 3, 2008

Source of Funds:

Cash, Vendor Placing

Deal Description:

Microsoft Corp cancelled its bid to acquire Yahoo! Inc for more than US$47.5 billion in cash and stock. On February 11, 2008 Yahoo Inc! formally announced its rejection of the unsolicited proposal by Microsoft Corp. The Board of Directors stated that the proposal substantially undervalued Yahoo! Inc and that it will continue to evaluate all of its strategic options. But, on May 3, 2008 it was reported that Microsoft Corp would have been willing to raise its offer price to US$33, yet Yahoo Inc's board rejected that offer continuing to demand a price of US$37.00 per share. This final rejection has brought an end to deal talks and Microsoft Corp has withdrawn its proposal and no longer intents to move to a hostile takeover. According to the official proposal, Microsoft Corp was offering to pay US$31 in cash or 0.9509 shares of its stock for each share of Yahoo! Inc. The consideration was subject to pro-ration so that half of the shares will be exchanged for cash and half for Microsoft Corp stock. Based on Microsoft Corp's January 31, 2008 close price of US$32.60, each share of Yahoo! Inc would have been acquired for approximately US$31. This represented about a 61.6% premium over Yahoo! Inc's January 31, 2008 close price of US$19.18. Yahoo! Inc provides marketing services to businesses across its owned and operated online properties and services. The acquisition would have allowed Microsoft Corp to be more competitive in the online advertising market and its competition with Google Inc. It expected the transaction to generate synergies of US$1 billion.

Transaction Notes:

BE = (1,337,165,049 YHOO shares outstanding * 0.9509 exchange ratio * US$32.60 MSFT close on 29 Jan 08) *50% stock consideration + (1,337,165,049 YHOO shares outstanding * US$31.00 cash) * 50% cash consideration

Equity Consideration:

$635,755,123

Premium Offered:

.413

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Share Price:

$30.999700

Original Offer Price:

$41,451,675,000

Price/Earnings:

80.935

Multiple of Book Value:

8.405

Terms:

Available

Method of Payment:

Combo

Cash Payment:

$20,726,058,260

Stock Payment:

$20,725,616,995

Total Invested Capital:

$42,201,303,000

Stock Exchange Ratio:

0.9509 : 1

Base Equity Price:

$41,451,675,255

TARGET: Yammer, Inc. 
BUYER: Microsoft Corp. 
SELLER: Yammer, Inc.



LAST UPDATE: September 5, 2013 
ANNOUNCE DATE: June 25, 2012 
EFFECTIVE DATE: July 19, 2012



DEAL NO.: 723783


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

July 19, 2012

Source of Funds:

Cash

Deal Description:

Microsoft Corp acquired Yammer Inc for US$1.1 billion in cash post adjustments. At announcement, Microsoft Corp announced that it would offer US$1.2 billion in cash for Yammer, Inc. With the completion, Yammer Inc will be fully integrated into the Microsoft Corp's Office Division while retaining its headquarters in San Francisco. The entire Yammer Inc team will be retained led by CEO David Sacks. The deal allows Microsoft Corp to add social-networking tools to its existing product portfolio. Based in San Francisco, California, Yammer Inc operates online enterprise application for employee communication. The company was founded in 2008 by David Sacks.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Original Offer Price:

$1,000,000,000

Closing Offer Price:

$1,100,000,000

Terms:

Available

Method of Payment:

Cash

Cash Payment:

$1,100,000,000

Total Invested Capital:

$1,100,000,000

Base Equity Price:

$1,100,000,000

EFFECTIVE DATE: January 7, 2000



DEAL NO.: 42520


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Public Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

January 7, 2000

Source of Funds:

Vendor Placing

Deal Description:

Microsoft acquired Visio for $1.5 billion in stock, exchanging .45 shares for each Visio share, as part of its mission of increasing productivity for businesses, and bringing visualization software to its current suite. Visio will become part of Microsofts business productivity group.

Transaction Notes:

Filings: S-4 11/2/99 - TS. Pooling of interests. BE = MSFT close 1/6/00 $110 * exch. ratio .45 * 30,165,749 o/s. Closed by AK. (Src Fix-It: Stock)

TARGET: Great Plains Software Inc 
BUYER: Microsoft Corp. 
SELLER: Great Plains Software Inc



LAST UPDATE: July 28, 2005 
ANNOUNCE DATE: December 21, 2000 
EFFECTIVE DATE: April 5, 2001



DEAL NO.: 136226


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Public Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

April 5, 2001

Source of Funds:

Vendor Placing

Deal Description:

Microsoft acquired Great Plains Software for approximately $1.1 billion in stock. The acquisition of Great Plains will accelerate the success of small and medium companies globally with integrated, extensible business management software solutions needed to succeed in an increasingly interconnected economy. The acquisition will also create new opportuinities for Microsoft and Great Plains partners to grow their businesses by delivering and integrating next generation solutions that take advantage of the .NET foundation of small and medium business applications that Microsoft and Great Plains will provide.

Transaction Notes:

BE = 20,226,146 * $51.9375 MSFT close on 4 Apr 01. Closed, GV.

Equity Consideration:

$20,226,146

Premium Offered:

-0.088

$51.938

TARGET: Tellme Networks, Inc. 
BUYER: Microsoft Corp. 
SELLER: Tellme Networks, Inc.



LAST UPDATE: March 16, 2007 
ANNOUNCE DATE: March 14, 2007



DEAL NO.: 414523


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Deal Description:

Microsoft Corp agreed to acquired Tellme Networks Inc for an undisclosed amount. Tellme Networks is a leading provider of voice services including nationwide directory assistance, enterprise customer services and voice-enabled mobile search. The Company employs 320 and operates from its Mountain View, CA, headquarters. The deal is expected to close in the second quarter 2007.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

LAST UPDATE: January 17, 2008

EFFECTIVE DATE: February 26, 2007



DEAL NO.: 412347


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

February 26, 2007

Deal Description:

Microsoft Corp acquired Medstory Inc for an undisclosed amount. Medstory, based in Foster City, CA, develops intelligent Web search technology specifically for health information. The Company will be merged into the Health Solutions Group, a recently formed division at Microsoft that will manage product development and delivery. The acquisition marks Microsoft's growth into the consumer health care market.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

DEAL NO.: 470246


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

April 18, 2008

Deal Description:

Microsoft Corp acquired Farecast Inc for an undisclosed price. The price is estimated to be around $115 million. Microsoft Corp will integrate the business into its MSN Travel operations. Madrona Venture Group LLC had invested in Farecast Inc, and stated the it had returned more than five times its original investment.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

DEAL NO.: 146456


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

June 21, 2001

Deal Description:

T1Msn, a joint venture between Telmex and Microsoft Corp, acquired Yupi Internet Inc for an undisclosed amount. Under the terms of the acquisition, Yupi Internet will combine with the operations of T1Msn and the new company will operate as T1Msn in Mexico and as Yupi/MSN in other North and South American markets.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

LAST UPDATE: May 13, 2008 
ANNOUNCE DATE: February 28, 2008 
EFFECTIVE DATE: February 28, 2008



DEAL NO.: 462157


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of non-US (foreign) company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

February 28, 2008

Deal Description:

Microsoft Corp has acquired YaData Ltd, an Israeli provider of online advertising solutions, for an undisclosed amount. The press reports the price at between SU$20 million and US$30 million. YaData was founded in July 2006, and has raised around US44 million in VC funding from Giza Ventures and Ofer Hit-Tech. The acquisition is subject to certain closing conditions, including receipt of required regulatory approvals.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

TARGET: RealNames Corp.

LAST UPDATE: May 13, 2008

EFFECTIVE DATE: March 14, 2000



DEAL NO.: 182730


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture Minority Interest

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

March 14, 2000

Deal Description:

Microsoft Corp acquired a 20% minority stake in RealNames Corp for an undisclosed amount to further strengthen its presence in the Internet keyword search engine market. Besides deploying racks of computers that match up keywords to the correct Web-pages, RealNames Corp also operates a naming committee that overseas who gets rights to which keywords.

Percent Sought:

20.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

TARGET: NCompass Labs, Inc. 
BUYER: Microsoft Corp. 
SELLER: NCompass Labs, Inc.



LAST UPDATE: May 13, 2008 
ANNOUNCE DATE: April 30, 2001 
EFFECTIVE DATE: April 30, 2001



DEAL NO.: 143664


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of non-US (foreign) company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

April 30, 2001

Deal Description:

Microsoft acquired NCompass Labs for an undisclosed price. The acquisition provides access to the NCompass Resolution 4.0 software application, a Web content management systems that enables businesses to quickly and cost-effectively deploy highly dynamic and personalized e-business Web sites. The acquisition by Microsoft is fueled by the high customer demand for Web content management solutions.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

Transaction Type:

DEAL NO.: 200700


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Private

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of non-US (foreign) company - Assets Acquired

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

June 10, 2003

Deal Description:

Microsoft Corp acquired the technology assets and related intellectual property of GeCAD Software Srl for an undisclosed amount. The acquisition will help Microsoft to enhance its technology expertise to develop a new antivirus software product to secure customers due to the increasing virus threats. Certain software developers of GeCAD will join Microsoft, but details have not been finalized yet, said Mike Nash, Corporate Vice President of the Security Business Unit of Microsoft.

Transaction Notes:

Factiva, SC.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

TARGET: AssetMetrix Corp. 
BUYER: Microsoft Corp. 
SELLER: AssetMetrix Corp.



LAST UPDATE: May 13, 2008 
ANNOUNCE DATE: April 27, 2006 
EFFECTIVE DATE: April 27, 2006



DEAL NO.: 372881


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of non-US (foreign) company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

April 27, 2006

Deal Description:

Microsoft Corp, a public company known for its Windows Operating System and Microsoft Office Software products, acquired AssetMetrix Inc, a private company that develops business solutions, including IT Cost Analysis, Security, and related software and integrated solutions, for an undisclosed amount. The acquisition will enable Microsoft to provide its consumers with a more comprehensive software product line with the addition of AssetMetrix's products, according to a quote by Director of Product Management, Ms. Felicity McGourty. Analyst Mr. Peter Pawlack with Directions on Microsoft stated that the acquisition will fill in a void that it had in its systems management portfolio, and "it will be a valuable enhancement to Systems Centre Configuration Manager 2007." AssetMetrix has 100,000 software titles and 200 reports related to asset and license managers.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * TARGET DETAILS * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * *

Name:

AssetMetrix Corp.

Country:

Canada

Industry:

Internet; Computer Software, Supplies & Services

Description:

Provides asset intelligence solutions

TARGET: Zignals Ltd. 
BUYER: Microsoft Corp. 
SELLER: Zignals Ltd.



LAST UPDATE: June 16, 2008 
ANNOUNCE DATE: June 12, 2008 
EFFECTIVE DATE: June 12, 2008



DEAL NO.: 478085


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture Minority Interest

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

June 12, 2008

Deal Description:

Microsoft Corp acquired a 15% minority stake in Zignals Ltd, an Irish online share price alert and trading service, for an undisclosed amount. The acquisition follows successful collaboration between the two companies on past projects. Zignals, headquartered in Dublin, Ireland, employs 10 and uses Microsoft's Solver Foundation software as the core of its platform which allows investors to track stocks traded on the Irish Stock Exchange, London Stock Exchange, New York Stock Exchange, Nasdaq and Euronext.

Percent Sought:

15.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

July 27, 2007

Deal Description:

Microsoft Corp acquired AdECN Inc for an undisclosed amount. Based near Santa Barbara, California, AdECN Inc provides an advertising exchange platform. This is part of Microsoft Corp's strategy to develop a comprehensive search and display advertising platform helping advertisers and publishers to maximize return on investment on their digital advertising investments.

100.000%

TARGET: Mobile Computing & Wireless Solutions 
BUYER: Microsoft Corp. 
SELLER: Mobile Computing & Wireless Solutions



LAST UPDATE: October 24, 2008 
ANNOUNCE DATE: June 26, 2008 
EFFECTIVE DATE: June 26, 2008



DEAL NO.: 480011


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of non-US (foreign) company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

June 26, 2008

Deal Description:

Microsoft Corp acquired Mobile Computing & Wireless Solutions (MobiComp) for an undisclosed amount. MobiComp is based in Braga, Portugal and develops software solutions. The group was founded in 2000 and has provided consumers with new security features and access to information while mobile. MobiComp is known for its breakthrough concepts and services its products include MobileKeeper Backup & Restore, MobileKeeper Sharing & Communities, and Active mTicker. The acquisition will contribute to Microsoft's existing list of products.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

TARGET: Wysiwyg Comunicacion Interactiva 
BUYER: Microsoft Corp. / Avenue A Razorfish, Inc. 
SELLER: Wysiwyg Comunicacion Interactiva



LAST UPDATE: November 3, 2008 
ANNOUNCE DATE: October 31, 2008 
EFFECTIVE DATE: October 31, 2008



DEAL NO.: 495920


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of non-US (foreign) company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

October 31, 2008

Deal Description:

Avenue A Razorfish Inc, ultimately owned by Microsoft Corp acquired Spanish digital advertising agency Wysiwyg Comunicacion Interactiva for an undisclosed amount. This deal represents a significant milestone as we build our network in Europe, where we already have operations in France, UK and Germany, said Darin Brown, president of Razorfish Europe, in a statement. The Madrid-based Wysiwyg will be known as Wysiwyg, a Razorfish company, and managed by its existing leadership team, according to a release. Founded in 1995, Wysiwyg works across all digital platforms, from websites and digital ads to web video and mobile marketing. The privately held company has 56 employees in Madrid.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * TARGET DETAILS * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * *

Name:

Wysiwyg Comunicacion Interactiva

Country:

Spain

Industry:

Internet; Miscellaneous Services

Description:

Provides interactive advertising services

TARGET: Tata Consultancy Services China Co. 
BUYER: Microsoft Corp. 
SELLER: Tata Consultancy Services Ltd.



LAST UPDATE: December 1, 2008 
ANNOUNCE DATE: November 23, 2006 
EFFECTIVE DATE: November 23, 2006



DEAL NO.: 399863


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Unit Minority

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

November 23, 2006

Deal Description:

Microsoft Corp acquired a 10.0% minority stake in Tata Consultancy Services China Co from Tata Consultancy Services Asia Pacific Pte Ltd for approximately RMB 9.4 million (US$ 1.2 million). Singapore based Tata Consultancy Services Asia Pacific is a subsidiary of publicly listed Tata Consultancy Services Ltd. Upon completion, Tata Consultancy Service Asia Pacific will reduce its equity interest in the target to 65.0%; the target's Chinese minority shareholders will hold the remaining 25.0%.

Percent Sought:

10.000%

Closing Offer Price:

$1,200,000

Terms:

Available

Total Invested Capital:

$1,200,000

Base Equity Price:

$1,200,000

Tata Consultancy Services China Co.

Country:

China

Exchange:

Other

Industry:

Internet; Computer Software, Supplies & Services

Description:

Provides information technology solution and consulting services

* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

March 7, 2006

Deal Description:

Microsoft Corp acquired Apptimum Inc for an undisclosed amount. The technology acquired from Apptimum Inc will make it easier for Microsoft Corp Windows customers to transfer applications to new computers offered in Windows Vista later this year.

TARGET: Rapt, Inc.

LAST UPDATE: January 5, 2009 
ANNOUNCE DATE: March 14, 2008 
EFFECTIVE DATE: May 1, 2008



DEAL NO.: 464785


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Vertical

Closing Date:

May 1, 2008

Deal Description:

Microsoft Corp acquired Rapt Inc, an alternative investment of Octane Capital Management LLC, Levensohn Venture Partners LLC and Accel Partners LLC, for an undisclosed amount. Rapt Inc, a provider of advertising yield management solutions for digital media publishers, will become a part of Microsoft's Advertiser and Publishing Solutions Group. This group provides advertising platforms and tools for advertisers, agencies and publishers.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

TARGET: Powerset, Inc. 
BUYER: Microsoft Corp. 
SELLER: Powerset, Inc.



LAST UPDATE: January 5, 2009 
ANNOUNCE DATE: June 26, 2008 
EFFECTIVE DATE: July 1, 2008



DEAL NO.: 480191


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

July 1, 2008

Deal Description:

Microsoft Corp acquired Powerset Inc for an undisclosed price. The purchase price is rumored to be around or slightly above $100 million. Powerset Inc has developed a technology that attempts to understand the full meanings of phrases. The move stems from the strategy of Microsoft Corp to better compete against Google and to make a strategic plan after its move to acquire Yahoo! fell through.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

TARGET: Kidaro, Inc. 
BUYER: Microsoft Corp. 
SELLER: Kidaro, Inc.



LAST UPDATE: January 5, 2009 
ANNOUNCE DATE: March 12, 2008 
EFFECTIVE DATE: May 22, 2008



DEAL NO.: 464310


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

May 22, 2008

Deal Description:

Microsoft Corp, a company that develops, manufactures, sells, and supports software products, acquired Kidaro Inc, one of the fastest-growing segments of the software industry, for an undisclosed sum. Kidaro Inc will be incorporated into Microsoft Corp's desktop virtualization product, which allows companies to deliver over an Internet network a "virtual" computer desktop different from the software running on the local machine.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

TARGET: DATAllegro, Inc. 
BUYER: Microsoft Corp. 
SELLER: DATAllegro, Inc.



LAST UPDATE: January 5, 2009 
ANNOUNCE DATE: July 24, 2008 
EFFECTIVE DATE: September 16, 2008



DEAL NO.: 484182


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

September 16, 2008

Deal Description:

Microsoft Corp acquired DATAllegro Inc, a provider of data warehouse appliances, for an undisclosed amount. The deal will extend the capabilities of Microsoft's data platform, making it easier and more cost-effective for customers of all sizes to manage and glean insight from the ever-expanding amount of data generated by and for businesses, employees and consumers. Microsoft Corp will retain most of the DATAllegro Inc team as well as its headquarters in Aliso Viejo, California.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * TARGET DETAILS * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * *

Name:

DATAllegro, Inc.

Country:

United States

Industry:

Internet; Computer Software, Supplies & Services

Description:

Provides data warehouse appliances

* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

January 22, 2008

Deal Description:

Microsoft Corp has acquired Calista Technologies Inc, a San Jose, California-based provider of business server software for a small businesses, from Greylock Partners and Lightspeed Venture Partners for an undisclosed amount. Calista Technologies had raised approximately US$5 million in VC funding since 2006 from Greylock Partners and Lightspeed Venture Partners.

100.000%

* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Purpose:

Horizontal

Deal Description:

Microsoft Corp announced its intent to acquire BigPark Inc for an undisclosed amount. BigPark Inc is an interactive online gaming company based in Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada. BigPark Inc's developers will join Microsoft Game Studios.

TARGET: Fast Search & Transfer ASA 
BUYER: Microsoft Corp. 
SELLER: Fast Search & Transfer ASA



LAST UPDATE: June 3, 2009 
ANNOUNCE DATE: January 8, 2008 
EFFECTIVE DATE: April 25, 2008



DEAL NO.: 453770


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition Tender Offer

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of non-US (foreign) company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

April 25, 2008

Attitude:

Friendly

Source of Funds:

Cash

Deal Description:

Microsoft Corp acquired, through a tender offer, Fast Search & Transfer ASA for approximately NOK6.4 billion (US$1.2 billion) in cash. Microsoft Corp offered NOK19 (US$3.5) for each Fast Search & Transfer ASA share and completed settlement on 25 April 2008. The offer represents a 42% premium to the closing share price on Jan. 4, 2008. Fast's board of directors unanimously recommended that its shareholders accept the offer. The offer was subject to customary terms and conditions, including receipt of acceptances representing more than 90% of Fast shares and voting power on a fully diluted basis, and receipt of all necessary regulatory approvals on terms acceptable to Microsoft. Microsoft Corp will operate Fast Search & Transfer ASA as a subsidiary. Fast Search & Transfer ASA provides software solutions for on-line search engine systems.

Transaction Notes:

BE = 336,692,960 FAST shares * NOK19 cash.

TARGET: Expedia, Inc. /Old/ 
BUYER: IAC/InterActiveCorp. 
SELLER: Microsoft Corp.



LAST UPDATE: July 7, 2009 
ANNOUNCE DATE: July 16, 2001 
EFFECTIVE DATE: February 5, 2002



DEAL NO.: 147986


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

February 5, 2002

Source of Funds:

Vendor Placing

Deal Description:

USA Networks acquired a 65% interest in Expedia from Microsoft for approximately $597.6 million in stock, plus $440.3 million in convertible redeemable preferred stock and $512.4 million in warrant options. In a separate transaction, USA Networks also acquired National Leisure Group. The acquisitions of Expedia and National Leisure Group will expand its estimated share of retail transactions conducted over the Internet and via television in the US from 5% to approximately 9% in 2001. These acquisitions, along with its interest in the Hotel Reservations Network, will form the USA Travel Group portfolio of companies.

Transaction Notes:

BE = ($28.81 USAI close 02/04/02 * 54,923,119 o/s * .6009 exch. ratio * 62.8485 % sought) + (33.75* 54,923,119 o/s * .3779 exch. ratio * 62.8485 % sought) + (35.1*54,923,119 o/s *.4229 exch. ratio* 62.8485 % sought) Advisor, 7/17/01 - KW. C

Copyright 2009 FactSet Mergerstat, LLC 
Mergerstat M & A Database



TARGET: Greenfield Online, Inc. /Internet Survey Business/ 
BUYER: Eurovestech PLC / ToLuna PLC 
SELLER: Microsoft Corp.



LAST UPDATE: September 18, 2009 
ANNOUNCE DATE: June 26, 2009 
EFFECTIVE DATE: July 16, 2009



DEAL NO.: 516255


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

July 16, 2009

Source of Funds:

Cash

Deal Description:

ToLuna Plc, a majority-owned subsidiary of Eurovestech Plc, acquired the Internet survey business of Greenfield Online Inc, a unit of Microsoft Corp, for US$40 million in cash. The transaction expands ToLuna Plc's presence in the US. The enlarged group will create an 11.9% market share of independent online panel providers and will be well positioned in the fast moving, high growth industry. Upon completion, the enlarged group will employ over 700 people spread across 11 countries. The acquisition will result in significant synergies from the integration of both entities and margin improvements from the reduced purchase cost of third party panels which, and will enhance ToLuna Plc's earnings per share in the year ending 31 December 2010. The business and assets of the Internet survey division include US based assets, together with the shares of subsidiaries incorporated in Canada, India, Germany, Romania, Australia, Japan and France.The transaction was carried out by ToLuna Plc's undisclosed newly incorporated subsidiary.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Original Offer Price:

$40,000,000

Closing Offer Price:

$40,000,000

Terms:

Available

Method of Payment:

Cash

Cash Payment:

$40,000,000

Total Invested Capital:

$40,000,000

Base Equity Price:

$40,000,000

Mergerstat M & A Database



TARGET: Razorfish, Inc. 
BUYER: Publicis Groupe SA 
SELLER: Microsoft Corp.



LAST UPDATE: October 15, 2009 
ANNOUNCE DATE: August 9, 2009 
EFFECTIVE DATE: October 14, 2009



DEAL NO.: 520402


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

October 14, 2009

Source of Funds:

Cash, Vendor Placing

Deal Description:

Publicis Groupe SA acquired Razorfish Inc from aQuantive Inc, a unit of Microsoft Corp for US$549.4 million in cash and stock. Pursuant to the deal terms, Publicis Groupe SA paid US$286.8 million in cash and 6,500,000 of its treasury shares, valued at US$262.6 million, to Razorfish Inc. As a result of the transaction, Microsoft Corp got a 3.3% stake in Publicis Groupe SA and Razorfish Inc became a part of VivaKi, a subsidiary of Publicis Groupe SA. Razorfish Inc was founded in 1995 and became part of Microsoft in 2007 as part of the US$6 billion aQuantive Inc acquisition. It generated revenue of approximately US$380 million at the fiscal year ending June 30, 2009. Publicis Groupe SA won the final bidding from an original field of some eight parties interested in the Microsoft unit.

Transaction Notes:

BE= Cash US$286,800,000 + Stock (US$40.40 (EUR28.435) PUB closed, October 13, 2009 * 6,500,000 PUB shares).

Equity Consideration:

$6,500,000

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Original Offer Price:

$530,000,000

Closing Offer Price:

$549,400,000

Terms:

Available

Method of Payment:

Combo

Cash Payment:

$368,000,000

Stock Payment:

$162,000,000

Total Invested Capital:

$530,000,000

Base Equity Price:

$530,000,000

LAST UPDATE: November 10, 2009 
ANNOUNCE DATE: November 9, 2009



DEAL NO.: 527216


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Horizontal

Deal Description:

Microsoft Corp agreed to acquire the entire business and assets of Teamprise from SourceGear LLC for an undisclosed amount. The transaction will provide Microsoft's customers a viable cross-platform development solution that will help business processes function quickly. Teamprise, located in Illinois, is a division of SourceGear focused on creating products and solutions for enterprise companies standardizing on Microsoft Visual Studio 2009 Team Foundation Server.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of non-US (foreign) company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

December 11, 2009

Deal Description:

Microsoft Corp acquired Opalis Software Inc for an undisclosed amount. Microsoft intends to integrate the company into its data center product line. Through the acquisition, Microsoft aims to better meet the demands of a range of large business customers in putting together otherwise incompatible systems. Opalis Software Inc engages in the development of IT process automation tools.

100.000%

* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Divestiture - Assets Acquired

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

June 26, 2009

Deal Description:

The Rosetta Biosoftware technologies will be become part of the Microsoft Amalga Life Sciences platform. Microsoft Corp is currently pursuing the hiring of Rosetta Biosoftware employees.

DEAL NO.: 542664


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture Minority Interest

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Horizontal

Amendment Date:

April 20, 2010

Closing Date:

September 13, 2010

Source of Funds:

Cash

Deal Description:

Beijing Ultrapower Software Co Ltd completed its acquisition of an 8% minority stake in Dalian Hi-Think Computer Technology Co Ltd from Microsoft China Investment Holdings Ltd, a subsidiary of Microsoft Corp for RMB73.7 million (US$10.8 million) in cash. Based in Liaoning, Dalian Hi-Think Computer Technology is primarily a computer software developer and software outsourcing services provider. The acquisition would allow the listed bidder to increase its income by entering into the software outsourcing market as well as further enhancing its R&D level.

8.000%

TARGET: Musiwave SA 
BUYER: Microsoft Corp. 
SELLER: Openwave Systems, Inc.



LAST UPDATE: September 28, 2010 
ANNOUNCE DATE: November 11, 2007 
EFFECTIVE DATE: December 31, 2007



DEAL NO.: 447753


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

December 31, 2007

Source of Funds:

Cash

Deal Description:

Microsoft Corp acquired the entire share capital of Musiwave SA from Openwave Systems Inc for EUR35.4 million (US$51.9 million) in cash, note receivable and in escrow. Under the terms of the transaction, MIcrosoft Corp offered to pay EUR28.2 million (US$41.4 million) in cash, a note receivable of EUR4 million (US$5.9 million) and EUR3.1 million (US$4.6 million) that Microsoft Corp placed in escrow. Musiwave SA specializes in mobile music entertainment solutions to operators and media and entertainment companies. Openwave Systems Inc is divesting its stake in Musiwave SA as part of its move to focus on its core business assets. The transaction is subject to customary closing conditions and regulatory approval.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Closing Offer Price:

$51,688,000

Terms:

Not disclosed

Method of Payment:

Cash

Cash Payment:

$-1,000,000

Total Invested Capital:

$51,688,000

TARGET: mTLD Top Level Domain Ltd. 
BUYER: Afilias Ltd. 
SELLER: Microsoft Corp.



LAST UPDATE: November 2, 2010 
ANNOUNCE DATE: February 11, 2010 
EFFECTIVE DATE: February 11, 2010



DEAL NO.: 536306


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

February 11, 2010

Deal Description:

Afilias Ltd acquired mTLD Top Level Domain Ltd, a subsidiary of Microsoft Corp, for an undisclosed amount. The acquisition of mTLD Top Level Domain Ltd, otherwise known as dotMobi, reflects Afilias' long term commitment to the success of the top level domains it supports and the communities that these domains serve. The strategic domain expertise of Afilias combined with the mobile industry support would be an accelerant for dotMobi's growth. Based in Dublin, Ireland, mTLD Top Level Domain Ltd or dotMobi provides domain registry services. It was founded by 14 mobile operators, network and device manufacturers, and Internet content providers, including Ericsson, Google, GSM Association, Hutchison 3, Nokia, Orascom Telecom, Samsung, Syniverse, T-Mobile, Telefonica, Telecom Italia, Visa, and Vodafone.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * TARGET DETAILS * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * *

Name:

mTLD Top Level Domain Ltd.

Country:

Ireland

Exchange:

NASDAQ

Industry:

Internet; Computer Software, Supplies & Services

Description:

Provides domain registry services

TARGET: ByteTaxi, Inc. 
BUYER: Microsoft Corp. 
SELLER: ByteTaxi, Inc.



LAST UPDATE: November 11, 2010 
ANNOUNCE DATE: November 3, 2005 
EFFECTIVE DATE: November 3, 2005



DEAL NO.: 354752


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

November 3, 2005

Deal Description:

Microsoft Corp. acquired Texas-based ByteTaxi Inc. for an undisclosed sum. ByteTaxi includes FolderShare, a subsidiary that provides clients with tools to create a private peer-to-peer network and synchronize files across multiple devices. FolderShare also allows private, remote access to clients' own files from any web browsers including Microsoft's own Internet Explorer.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

Provides remote access and files synchronizing services

LAST UPDATE: November 18, 2010 
ANNOUNCE DATE: May 11, 2005 
EFFECTIVE DATE: May 11, 2005



DEAL NO.: 336905


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company - Assets Acquired

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

May 11, 2005

Deal Description:

Microsoft Corp acquired the assets of MessageCast Inc for an undisclosed amount. MessageCast Inc is a leading provider of automated alerting and messaging technology that currently supports the MSN Alerts service. With this acquisition, Microsoft will integrate MessageCast's innovative technology and products into MSN in order to improve its ability to help consumers manage their time and information.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

LAST UPDATE: May 31, 2011

EFFECTIVE DATE: May 9, 2007



DEAL NO.: 421427


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Unit Minority

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

May 9, 2007

Deal Description:

Microsoft Corp acquired a 4% minority stake in CareerBuilder LLC from Career Holdings Inc for an undisclosed price. In addition, Microsoft Corp extended a deal to make CareerBuilder LLC the exclusive content provider to MSN Careers channel through 2013. In return, CareerBuilder will pay MSN up to US$443 million during the seven-year period.

Percent Sought:

4.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

DEAL NO.: 135110


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

December 27, 2000

Deal Description:

Microsoft acquired substantially all of the assets of Digital Anvil for an undisclosed amount to enhance its product offerings. The acquisition will strengthen its commitement to producing top-quality PC and Xbox titles. Under the terms of the transaction, Microsoft will gain the rights to select Digital Anvil titles, as well as the yet-to-be announced title currently in development for the Xbox video game system.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture Minority Interest

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Financial

Closing Date:

July 23, 2001

Deal Description:

Microsoft Corp, Redmond, Washington, US, the world leader in computer software, acquired a minority stake of less than 10% in Sendo Holdings plc, Birmingham, West Midlands, England, a manufacturer of mobile telephone handsets. Consideration approximately US$10m (GB£7,056,152). Under the terms of the deal, Microsoft retains the option to increase the stake to as much as 20%.

Percent Sought:

-1.000%

Original Offer Price:

$10,000,000

Closing Offer Price:

$10,000,000

Terms:

Available

$10,000,000

$10,000,000

TARGET: Wireless Knowledge Inc 
BUYER: QUALCOMM, Inc. 
SELLER: Microsoft Corp.



LAST UPDATE: June 26, 2002 
ANNOUNCE DATE: November 5, 2001 
EFFECTIVE DATE: November 5, 2001



DEAL NO.: 155974


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

November 5, 2001

Deal Description:

QUALCOMM Inc acquired the remaining 50% interest in Wireless Knowledge Inc from Microsoft Corp, its 50/50 joint venture partner, for an undisclosed amount. The new structure will enable Wireless Knowledge to accelerate the adoption of next-generation mobility solutions within the enterprise running on CDMA2000 and WCDMA.

Transaction Notes:

Factiva, TS.

Percent Owned Before:

50.000%

Percent Sought:

50.000%

* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture Minority Interest

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Horizontal

Deal Description:

Microsoft Corp, the US software group, acquired a minority stake in Helicon Publishing, Oxford, publisher of reference works. Random House Publishing and Klett Publishing also reinvested in Helicon following an initial equity investment in the company in 1992 during the MBO of the Hutchinson reference business from Random House. DEAL NO.: 181444


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Public Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

December 12, 2002

Source of Funds:

Cash

Deal Description:

Microsoft acquired Vicinity for about $90.7 million in cash. This acquisition will enable Vicinity to enhance and expand its production capabilities and technology product and service offerings. The business of Vicinity will be merged with the Microsoft MapPoint business unit. The resulting team will focus on delivering benefits of location intelligence in a wide range of enterprise and consumer applications and services.

Transaction Notes:

BE=$3.33 in cash x 27,249,643 VCNT o/s. Update, Closed by RS.

Transaction Type:

Purpose:

Closing Date:

July 1, 2000

Deal Description:

Before the accord with Microsoft, the major shareholders in Blixer were Cir Compagnie Industriali Riunite Spa and Cofide Compagnia Finanziaria De Benedetti Spa, Rome, Lazio, Italy, the two holding companies owned by entrepreneur Carlo De Benedetti, which held together a 32.5% stake, Kiwi I, the venture capital firm owned by venture capitalist Eserino Piol, with a 32.5% stake, and a group of three private investors with a further 32.5% stake. The rest was held by the management

-1.000%

* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture Minority Interest

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

July 1, 2000

Deal Description:

Microsoft Corporation, Redmond, Washington, USA, the world leader in computer software, services and internet technologies for personal and business computing, acquired a 22.98% stake in Telewest Communications Plc, Woking, Surrey, England, the telecommunications group. Prior to this transaction, Microsoft held a 1.97% stake in Telewest. Consideration US$2.4bn (GB61.58bn).

TARGET: Progressive Networks Inc 
BUYER: Microsoft Corp. 
SELLER: Progressive Networks Inc



LAST UPDATE: June 30, 2003 
ANNOUNCE DATE: July 21, 1997 
EFFECTIVE DATE: July 21, 1997



DEAL NO.: 203288


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture Minority Interest

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

July 21, 1997

Deal Description:

Microsoft Corp acquired an undisclosed minority stake in Progressive Networks Inc for an undisclosed amount. Microsoft Corp intends to incorporate the RealAudio and RealVideo technologies of Progressive Networks Inc into its own streaming technology called NetShow. In addition, Microsoft Corp will also include Progressive Networks Inc products in its Internet Explorer browser and intend to push Active Streaming Format of Microsoft Corp as an industry standard.

Percent Sought:

-1.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

TARGET: M Holographix Kft 
BUYER: Eco.net Hungary Kft 
SELLER: Microsoft Corp.



LAST UPDATE: September 30, 2003 
ANNOUNCE DATE: September 15, 2003 
EFFECTIVE DATE: September 15, 2003



DEAL NO.: 220118


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

September 15, 2003

Deal Description:

Econet.hu Rt acquired M-Holographix Kft, a subsidiary of Microsoft Corp, from Microsoft.NET for an undisclosed amount. The acquisition enables Econet.hu Rt to offer Internet and Intranet solutions independently of the platform. M-Holographix Kft posted a revenue of HUF40 million (US$170,240) in 2002. Among M-Holographix Kft customers are Budapest Commodity Exchange, the Ministry of Education, the Hungarian magazine HVG Online, and the Internet company of Hungarian telecommunication firm Matav.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

Mergerstat M & A Database



TARGET: PlaceWare, Inc. 
BUYER: Microsoft Corp. 
SELLER: PlaceWare, Inc.



LAST UPDATE: October 7, 2003 
ANNOUNCE DATE: January 21, 2003 
EFFECTIVE DATE: April 30, 2003



DEAL NO.: 188666


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

April 30, 2003

Deal Description:

Microsoft Corp acquired PlaceWare Inc for approximately $200 million to expand its existing Web conferencing base to offer more complete online business communication tools and solutions to its customers and industry partners. PlaceWare was founded in 1996, and has already attracted more than 3,100 client companies to use its Web conferencing services. As a result of the closing, PlaceWare Inc became part of the newly formed unit of Microsoft, the Real Time Collaboration Group, which is headed by Anoop Gupta, currently a technical advisor to the Chairman of Microsoft, Bill Gates.

Transaction Notes:

Update, Closed, RS.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Original Offer Price:

$200,000,000

Closing Offer Price:

$200,000,000

Terms:

Available

Total Invested Capital:

$200,000,000

Base Equity Price:

$200,000,000


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * TARGET DETAILS * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * *

Name:

PlaceWare, Inc.

Country:

United States

Industry:

Internet; Computer Software, Supplies & Services

Description:

Provides web conferencing services and products.

Horizontal

The acquisition will compliment Skype SARL's existing platform while enhancing the services they offer. Mindless Dribble Inc is based in New York, United States and provides group texting and conference calling services.

September 28, 2011

Deal Description:

The acquisition enables both companies to continue to provide effective online advertising services. The acquired division is based in Australia and provides advertising services. Nine Entertainment Co Pty Ltd is majority-owned by CVC Capital Partners Ltd.

* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition Tender Offer

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Public Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

October 14, 2008

Attitude:

Friendly

Source of Funds:

Cash

Deal Description:

Microsoft Corp acquired Greenfield Online Inc via a tender offer for approximately US$460.9 million in cash. Greenfield Online Inc terminated its prior agreement to be acquired by Quadrangle Group LLC. Greenfield Online Inc's subsidiary Ciao GmbH, who is one of Europe's leading price comparison, shopping and consumer reviews site, will extend Microsoft Corp's search and e-commerce services in Europe.

TARGET: Tellme Networks, Inc. 
BUYER: 24/7 Customer, Inc. 
SELLER: Microsoft Corp.



LAST UPDATE: February 8, 2012 
ANNOUNCE DATE: February 7, 2012



DEAL NO.: 711106


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Horizontal

Deal Description:

24/7 Customer Inc entered into an agreement to acquire Tellme Networks Inc from Microsoft Corp for an undisclosed amount. Following the acquisition, Tellme Networks Inc will be completely merged with 24/7 Customer Inc complimenting the latter's Predictive Experience platform. In addition to this, Microsoft Corp will gain an undisclosed stake in 24/7 Customer Inc upon completion. The deal includes research and development partnerships and IP licensing. The acquisition is expected to be earnings accretive. Tellme Networks Inc is based in Mountain View, California, United States, and provides voice application network and communication services.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * TARGET DETAILS * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * *

Country:

United States

NASDAQ

Provides voice application network and communication services

* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

March 19, 2012

Source of Funds:

Cash

Deal Description:

LeGuide.com SA has acquired Ciao GmbH from Microsoft Corp for an undisclosed amount in cash. The transaction expands LeGuide.com's business services and will make the company the first independent online shopping guide in Europe. Established in 1999 in Munich, Germany, Ciao GmbH operates an online shopping platform.

Press Play ApS is based in Copenhagen, Denmark and provides game development and graphic design services. The company has 20 employees.

FOCUS - 88 of 246 DOCUMENTS


Copyright 2012 FactSet Mergerstat, LLC 
Mergerstat M & A Database



TARGET: aQuantive, Inc. 
BUYER: Microsoft Corp. 
SELLER: aQuantive, Inc.



LAST UPDATE: July 20, 2012 
ANNOUNCE DATE: May 18, 2007 
EFFECTIVE DATE: August 13, 2007



DEAL NO.: 422749


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Public Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

August 13, 2007

Source of Funds:

Cash

Deal Description:

Microsoft Corp acquired aQuantive Inc for approximately $5.4 billion in cash. Pursuant to the agreement, Microsoft Corp acquired each share at $66.50 per share in cash. The purchase price represents an 85% premium over the closing price of aQuantive Inc on May 17, 2007 of $35.87. The transaction expands upon Microsoft Corp's outlined vision to provide the advertising industry with an Internet-wide advertising platform, as well as a set of tools and services that help generate the highest possible return on advertising investments. aQuantive Inc, with approximately 2600 employees, will continue to operate from its headquarters as apart of Microsoft's Online Services Business. aQuantive Inc provides online advertising services.

Transaction Notes:

Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

July 31, 2012

Deal Description:

Perceptive Pixel Inc will be fully integrated into the Microsoft Corp's Office Division. Founded in 2006, Perceptive Pixel Inc is based in New York, New York, United States, and develops & markets advanced multi touch solutions.

Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

October 4, 2012

LAST UPDATE: October 19, 2012 
ANNOUNCE DATE: October 17, 2012 
EFFECTIVE DATE: October 17, 2012



DEAL NO.: 736340


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

October 17, 2012

Deal Description:

Microsoft Corp acquired MarketingPilot Software LLC for an undisclosed amount. The transaction enhances Microsoft Corp's portfolio of marketing automation software services. As part of the transaction, all of the employees of MarketingPilot Software LLC will join Microsoft Corp and MarketingPilot Software LLC would operate as a subsidiary of Microsoft Corp. MarketingPilot Software LLC is located in Evanston, Illinois, and provides marketing automation software solutions to marketing departments and advertising agencies.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

LAST UPDATE: January 11, 2013

EFFECTIVE DATE: January 10, 2013



DEAL NO.: 743439


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

January 10, 2013

Deal Description:

Microsoft Corp acquired id8 Group R2 Studios Inc, trading as R2 Studios, for an undisclosed amount. The transaction enhances Microsoft Corp's portfolio of software applications for entertainment offerings and strengthens Microsoft Corp' Xbox unit functionality. Following the acquisition, Blake KriKorian, Founder of id8 Group R2 Studios Inc would join Xbox, a unit of Microsoft Corp as a corporate vice president for its Interactive Entertainment Business and Blake KriKorian will report to Marc Whitten, Chief Product Officer for Interactive Entertainment Business. Founded in 2011, id8 Group R2 Studios Inc is located in United States and develops home-entertainment technology and automation software applications.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

TARGET: MSNBC.com 
BUYER: Comcast Corp. / NBCUniversal Media LLC 
SELLER: Microsoft Corp.



LAST UPDATE: February 21, 2013 
ANNOUNCE DATE: July 15, 2012 
EFFECTIVE DATE: July 15, 2012



DEAL NO.: 721690


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Horizontal

Amendment Date:

May 25, 2012

Closing Date:

July 15, 2012

Deal Description:

NBCUniversal Media LLC, a subsidiary of Comcast Corp, acquired the remaining 50% minority stake it does not already own in MSNBC.com from Microsoft Corp for US$195 million. If the deal pushes through, NBCUniversal Media LLC could launch a separate NBC News site and bring MSNBC.com's content more in line with the network's more liberal primetime lineup. Based in Redmond, Washington, MSNBC.com operates an Internet portal. On May 25, 2012, NBCUniversal Media LLC was rumored to be interested in acquiring MSNBC.com.

Percent Owned Before:

50.000%

Percent Sought:

50.000%

Original Offer Price:

$195,000,000

Closing Offer Price:

$195,000,000

Terms:

$195,000,000

$195,000,000

DEAL NO.: 748725


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

February 28, 2013

Deal Description:

Facebook Inc acquired Atlas Solutions Inc, a subsidiary of Microsoft Corp, for an undisclosed amount. The acquisition strengthens Facebook Inc's service offerings, and also expands its customer base. Following the acquisition, Atlas Solutions Inc's team would join Facebook Inc. Atlas Solutions Inc is located in Seattle, Washington, United States and provides advertising services through online.

DEAL NO.: 736110


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

November 15, 2012

Deal Description:

Microsoft Corp acquired StorSimple Inc for an undisclosed amount. The acquisition expands Microsoft Corp's portfolio of software services. Following the acquisition, StorSimple Inc's staff would join Microsoft Corp. The acquisition adds StorSimple's Cloud-integrated Storage solutions to complement Microsoft's Cloud OS product. StorSimple Inc is located in Santa Clara, California, United States and provides enterprise cloud storage solutions for Windows and VMware infrastructures.

TARGET: Microsoft Corp. /Mediaroom Bus/ 
BUYER: LM Ericsson Telefon AB 
SELLER: Microsoft Corp.



LAST UPDATE: December 6, 2013 
ANNOUNCE DATE: April 8, 2013 
EFFECTIVE DATE: September 5, 2013



DEAL NO.: 752086


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Divestiture - Assets Acquired

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

September 5, 2013

Deal Description:

LM Ericsson Telefon AB acquired the business and assets of the Mediaroom operations of Microsoft Corp for an undisclosed amount. The acquisition increases LM Ericsson Telefon AB's market share to more than 25% in the video distribution segment. Upon completion of the transaction, the target would be integrated into LM Ericsson Telefon AB's Business Unit Support Solutions division. The deal was subject to regulatory approvals. Microsoft Corp's Mediaroom business, with approximately 400 employees, distributes videos to IPTV operators.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

TARGET: Skype Technologies SA 
BUYER: Microsoft Corp. 
SELLER: Skype Technologies SA



LAST UPDATE: December 11, 2013 
ANNOUNCE DATE: May 10, 2011 
EFFECTIVE DATE: October 13, 2011



DEAL NO.: 585689


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of non-US (foreign) company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

October 13, 2011

Source of Funds:

Cash

Deal Description:

Microsoft Corp acquired Skype Technologies SA from Silver Lake Partners, eBay Inc, Andreessen Horowitz LLC, Canada Pension Plan Investment Board (Canada) and Joltid Ltd, for EUR6 billion (US$8.5 billion) in cash including assumption of debt. The transaction would further strengthen the product offerings of Microsoft Corp. As part of the agreement, Tony Bates, CEO of Skype Technologies SA, would become the president of the Microsoft Skype division. The transaction was approved by the Board of Directors of Microsoft Corp and Skype Technologies SA. Founded in 2003, Luxembourg-based Skype Technologies SA provides communications services via the internet. The transaction was subject to customary closing conditions and regulatory approvals. Facebook Inc and Google Inc were rumored to be in negotiations to acquire Skype Technologies SA. On June 17, 2011, the transaction received Antitrust approval from the US Federal Trade Commission. Financial Times announced on October 5, 2011 that the EU Competition authority was expected to approve the transaction in the coming days. On October 8, 2011, the EU Competition authority approved the transaction between Microsoft Corp and Skype Technologies SA. On December 11, 2013, the EU Court has rejected Cisco's appeal to overturn the transaction's clearance due to possible competition problems.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Closing Offer Price:

$8,359,079,000

Price/Earnings:

1,294.434

Multiple of Book Value:

-11.199

Terms:

Available

Method of Payment:

Cash

Cash Payment:

$8,553,620,938

Total Invested Capital:

$9,278,481,000

Base Equity Price:

$8,553,620,938


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * TARGET DETAILS * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * *

Name:

Skype Technologies SA

Country:

Luxembourg

Industry:

Communications

Description:

Provides communications services via Internet

SELLER: Microsoft Corp.



LAST UPDATE: February 24, 2014 
ANNOUNCE DATE: October 14, 2013 
EFFECTIVE DATE: November 1, 2013



DEAL NO.: 778268


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

November 1, 2013

Deal Description:

Nine Entertainment Co Holdings Pty Ltd acquired the remaining 50% stake it did not own in ninemsn Pty Ltd, doing business as Mi9, from Microsoft Corp for a reported value of AUD40 million (US$37.9 million). The acquisition strengthens Nine Entertainment's digital video business. The transaction would be effective on November 1, 2013. Established in 1997, Mi9 is located in Sydney, New South Wales, Australia and provides online media services. Following the acquisition, Mi9's Mark Britt would continue as CEO of the target company.

* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of non-US (foreign) company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

June 30, 2006

Deal Description:

Microsoft Corp acquired webHancer Corp for an undisclosed amount. The acquisition allows Microsoft Corp to increase its expertise and expands its platform in software solutions industry and also expands its customer base globally. webHancer Corp is located in Ottawa, Ontario, Canada and provides web site customer intelligence solutions for web enterprises. Reportedly On May 16, 2006, Microsoft Corp was plans to acquire webHancer Corp for CAD11.1 million (US$10 million).

SELLER: 3DV Systems Ltd.



LAST UPDATE: February 11, 2015 
ANNOUNCE DATE: June 3, 2009 
EFFECTIVE DATE: June 24, 2009



DEAL NO.: 816746


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of non-US (foreign) company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

June 24, 2009

Deal Description:

Microsoft Corp acquired 3DV Systems Ltd for an undisclosed amount. Initially deal was rumored to be acquire for US$35 million. The transaction would enhance Microsoft Corp's portfolio of software solutions. 3DV Systems Ltd is a portfolio company of RDC Rafael Development Corp Ltd, Pitango Venture Capital, Formula Ventures Ltd, Shamrock Israel Growth Fund Advisors Ltd, Challenge Partners and Kleiner Perkins Caufield & Byers LLC. 3DV Systems Ltd is located in Yokneam, Israel and develops and markets video imaging technologies.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Closing Offer Price:

$8,408,000

Terms:

Not disclosed

EFFECTIVE DATE: March 3, 2014



DEAL NO.: 781600


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of non-US (foreign) company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

March 3, 2014

Deal Description:

Encore Business Solutions Inc, a subsidiary of Microsoft Corp, acquired Candlewest Systems Group Ltd for an undisclosed amount. The acquisition would strengthen the service offerings of Encore Business Solutions Inc in enterprise resource planning and customer relationship management solutions industry and also expands its customer base globally. Candlewest Systems Group Ltd. is located in Burnaby, British Columbia, Canada and provides enterprise resource planning and customer relationship management software solutions.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of non-US (foreign) company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

May 1, 2014

Deal Description:

Microsoft Corp acquired GreenButton Ltd, a portfolio company of Movac Ltd, for an undisclosed amount. The transaction is in line with growth strategy of Microsoft Corp and enhances its portfolio of software solutions offerings. Founded in 2006, GreenButton Ltd is located in Wellington, New Zealand and provides cloud computing solutions.

DEAL NO.: 789437


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of non-US (foreign) company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

May 28, 2014

Deal Description:

Microsoft Corp acquired Ubikod SARL, trading as Capptain, for an undisclosed amount. The acquisition allows Microsoft Corp to expand and strengthen the capabilities of its Azure platform for mobile app developers. Ubikod SARL is located in Paris, Ile-de-France, France and develops and distributes software for mobile and website development.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of non-US (foreign) company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

July 2, 2014

Deal Description:

Microsoft Corp acquired SyntaxTree SRL for an undisclosed amount. The acquisition would strengthen the service offerings of Microsoft Corp in developing tools and software solutions industry and also expands its customer base globally. As part of the acquisition, employees of SyntaxTree SRL would join Microsoft Corp. SyntaxTree SRL is located in Lyon, Rhone-Alpes, France and provides software services.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

TARGET: Parature, Inc. 
BUYER: Microsoft Corp. 
SELLER: Parature, Inc.



LAST UPDATE: July 8, 2014 
ANNOUNCE DATE: January 6, 2014 
EFFECTIVE DATE: January 6, 2014



DEAL NO.: 775626


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

January 6, 2014

Deal Description:

Microsoft Corp acquired Parature Inc for US$100 million. The transaction boost Microsoft Corp's customer service software offering. Parature Inc will be folded in Microsoft Corp's Microsoft Dynamics. The transaction is the first outward-facing CRM acquisition for Microsoft Corp. Parature Inc employees joined Microsoft as part of the acquisition. Founded in 2000, Cyracle Technologies Inc was launched by Duke Chung and four other Cornell University Students, and three years later changed its name to Parature Inc. Parature Inc is located in Herndon, Virginia, United States and provides web-based social and customer service software.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Closing Offer Price:

$100,000,000

Terms:

Available

Method of Payment:

Cash

Cash Payment:

$100,000,000

Total Invested Capital:

$100,000,000

Base Equity Price:

$100,000,000

TARGET: Mojang AB 
BUYER: Microsoft Corp. 
SELLER: Mojang AB



LAST UPDATE: November 11, 2014 
ANNOUNCE DATE: September 15, 2014 
EFFECTIVE DATE: November 7, 2014



DEAL NO.: 800300


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of non-US (foreign) company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

November 7, 2014

Deal Description:

Microsoft Corp acquired Mojang AB for SEK17.8 billion (US$2.5 billion). Following the transaction, Mojang AB will join Microsoft Studios. The acquisition will strengthen the video game business of Microsoft Corp. Initially on September 9, 2014, it was rumored that Microsoft was in talks to acquire Mojang AB for SEK14.2 billion (US$2 billion). Based in Sweden, Mojang AB is the developer of the "Minecraft" video game. The company was founded by Markus Persson and generated revenues of SEK2.1 billion (US$292.4 million) with a profit of SEK816 million (US$115.3 million) in 2013. The deal was subject to customary closing conditions and regulatory approvals and was expected to close in late 2014.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Closing Offer Price:

$1,989,867,000

Price/Earnings:

21.900

Terms:

Available

Method of Payment:

Cash

Cash Payment:

$2,504,914,570

Total Invested Capital:

$2,504,915,000

Base Equity Price:

$2,504,914,570

TARGET: Aorato Ltd. 
BUYER: Microsoft Corp. 
SELLER: Aorato Ltd.



LAST UPDATE: November 14, 2014 
ANNOUNCE DATE: November 13, 2014 
EFFECTIVE DATE: November 13, 2014



DEAL NO.: 807380


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of non-US (foreign) company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

November 13, 2014

Deal Description:

Microsoft Corp acquired Aorato Ltd for an undisclosed amount. According to people familiar with the transaction, Microsoft Corp paid about ILS760.5 million (US$200 million) for the company. Through the acquisition, Microsoft Corp will be able to improve the security for their costumers. Aorato Ltd is located in Herzliya, Tel Aviv, Israel and develops a technology that provides protection to enterprise resources from cyber attacks.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Closing Offer Price:

$199,716,000

Terms:

Available

Method of Payment:

Cash

Cash Payment:

$199,716,397

Total Invested Capital:

$199,716,000

Base Equity Price:

$199,716,397

Name:

Aorato Ltd.

Country:

Israel

Industry:

Miscellaneous Services

Description:

Develops a technology that provides protection to enterprise resources from cyber attacks

Microsoft Corp acquired Acompli Inc for an undisclosed amount. The transaction has reported value of approximately US$200 million in cash. The acquisition would strengthens Microsoft Corp's portfolio of email services. Acompli Inc is a portfolio company of Felicis Ventures LLC, Harrison Metal LLC and Redpoint Ventures. Acompli Inc is located in San Francisco, California, United States and develops mobile email applications.

* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of non-US (foreign) company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

December 11, 2014

Deal Description:

Microsoft Corp acquired Bit Stadium GmbH for an undisclosed amount. The transaction enhances Microsoft Corp's portfolio of mobile applications offerings. Bit Stadium GmbH owns and operates HockeyApp. As part of the transaction, all the employees of HockeyApp would join Microsoft Corp. Bit Stadium GmbH is located in Stuttgart, Baden Wuerttemberg, Germany and develops, distributes and provides mobile applications.

TARGET: MixRadio 
BUYER: NAVER Corp. / LINE Corp. 
SELLER: Microsoft Corp.



LAST UPDATE: January 23, 2015 
ANNOUNCE DATE: December 19, 2014



DEAL NO.: 811771


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Horizontal

Deal Description:

LINE Corp, a wholly-owned unit of NAVER Corp agreed to acquire MixRadio from Microsoft Corp for an undisclosed amount. The acquisition will allow LINE Corp to offer a personalized music experience as a third party service on Lumia smart phones and to support it's future expansion and development. Following the transaction, MixRadio's leadership team will continue with the company. MixRadio is located in the US and provides music streaming services. The deal is expected to close by January 2015.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

DEAL NO.: 814831


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

January 20, 2015

Deal Description:

Microsoft Corp acquired Equivio Inc for an undisclosed amount. The transaction was reported to be valued between US$150 million to US$200 million. Microsoft Corp has raised US$0.5 million through private investors. The transaction would enhance Microsoft Corp's portfolio of software solutions and also expand its foothold on the e-discovery market. Founded in 2004, Equivio Inc is located in Kensington, Maryland, United States and develops text analysis software. The transaction was effective from October 2014.

Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Amendment Date:

February 4, 2015

Closing Date:

February 11, 2015

Deal Description:

Microsoft Corp acquired Sunrise Atelier Inc, which is a portfolio company of Balderton Capital UK LLP, for a reported value of US$100 million. The acquisition is in line with Microsoft Corp's goal of reinventing productivity. Upon completion, Sunrise Atelier Inc's team would join the bidder. Microsoft Corp's On February 4, 2015, it was initially rumored that the bidder was interested in acquiring the target. Sunrise Atelier Inc is located in New York, New York, United States and provides calendar services.

DEAL NO.: 822023


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

March 27, 2015

Deal Description:

Microsoft Corp acquired EditRing Inc, trading as LiveLoop Inc, a portfolio company of New Enterprise Associates LLC and Webb Investment Network LLC for an undisclosed amount. The acquisition enhances Microsoft Corp's existing infrastructure. Following the transaction, EditRing Inc's team would join Microsoft Corp. EditRing Inc would shut down its operations on April 24, 2015. Founded by David Nelson and Amal Dorai, EditRing Inc is located in Stanford, California, United States and develops a cloud-based document sharing software.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

DEAL NO.: 815242


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

April 6, 2015

Deal Description:

Microsoft Corp acquired Revolution Analytics Inc, a portfolio company of Intel Capital Corp, Presidio STX LLC, and North Bridge Venture Partners for an undisclosed amount. The transaction would enhance Microsoft Corp's portfolio of software solutions and would also help its customers use advanced analytics within Microsoft data platforms on-premises, in hybrid cloud environments and on Microsoft Azure. Revolution Analytics Inc is located in Mountain View, California, United States and provides software and services based on the open source R project for statistical computing.

100.000%

TARGET: N-Trig Ltd. /Surface Pen Technology Ops/ 
BUYER: Microsoft Corp. 
SELLER: N-trig Ltd.



LAST UPDATE: May 12, 2015 
ANNOUNCE DATE: May 1, 2015 
EFFECTIVE DATE: May 1, 2015



DEAL NO.: 817411


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Divestiture - Assets Acquired

Purpose:

Horizontal

Amendment Date:

April 30, 2015

Closing Date:

May 1, 2015

Deal Description:

Microsoft Corp acquired the Surface Pen Technology with related assets from N-trig Ltd for ILS115.9 million (US$30 million). On April 30, 2015, rumors arose that Microsoft Corp had singed an agreement to pay the business and assets from N-trig Ltd. Earlier rumors from February, 2015 speculated that Microsoft Corp was about to acquire the whole company for over ILS772.8 million (US$200 million). Microsoft Corp owns since before a 6.1% stake of N-trig Ltd. The acquisition will give the company a stronger position to continue develop the technology. The acquired business designs, develops and markets dual-mode pen and touch input devices. According to sources, the employees that previously worked on the technology will move to Microsoft office in Israel.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Closing Offer Price:

$30,000,000

Terms:

Available

Method of Payment:

Cash

Cash Payment:

$29,999,999

Total Invested Capital:

$29,869,000

Base Equity Price:

$29,999,999

N-Trig Ltd. /Surface Pen Technology Ops/

Country:

Israel

Industry:

Office Equipment & Computer Hardware

Description:

Designs, develops and markets dual-mode pen and touch input devices

DEAL NO.: 828962


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of non-US (foreign) company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

June 2, 2015

Deal Description:

Microsoft Corp acquired 6 Wunderkinder GmbH, also known as Wunderlist, a portfolio company of Earlybird Venture Capital GmbH & Co KG, Atomico (UK) Partners LLP and Sequoia Capital for an undisclosed amount. Reportedly, the transaction would be valued between EUR91.8 million (US$100 million) to EUR183.5 million (US$200 million). Founded in 2010, 6 Wunderkinder GmbH is located in Berlin, Germany and designs and develops cloud-based platform independent productivity applications.

TARGET: Microsoft Corp. /Mapping Ops/ 
BUYER: Uber Technologies, Inc. 
SELLER: Microsoft Corp.



LAST UPDATE: June 30, 2015 
ANNOUNCE DATE: June 29, 2015



DEAL NO.: 832376


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Divestiture - Assets Acquired

Purpose:

Horizontal

Deal Description:

Uber Technologies Inc agreed to acquire the business and assets of mapping operation of Microsoft Corp, for an undisclosed amount. Uber Technologies Inc, is a portfolio company of Baidu Inc, TPG Capital Management LP, Benchmark Capital Management Co LLC, A-Grade Investments, Lowercase Capital LLC, Kapor Capital, First Round Capital, Founder Collective (Ventures) and Google Ventures. The transaction enhances Uber Technologies Inc's service offerings. As part of the transaction, around 100 data collection engineers of Microsoft Corp will join Uber Technologies Inc. The mapping operation of Microsoft Corp provides mapping services.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

LAST UPDATE: June 30, 2015

EFFECTIVE DATE: June 29, 2015



DEAL NO.: 832267


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Divestiture - Assets Acquired

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

June 29, 2015

Deal Description:

AOL Inc, a subsidiary of Verizon Communications Inc, acquired all the assets and business of Web Advertising Business of Microsoft Corp, for an undisclosed amount. The transaction enhances AOL Inc's portfolio of web advertising services. As part of the transaction, 1200 employees of Web Advertising Business would join AOL Inc. The Web Advertising Business provides online advertising services.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

DEAL NO.: 830086


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

June 10, 2015

Deal Description:

Microsoft Corp acquired BlueStripe Software Inc, a portfolio company of Trinity Ventures LP and Wednesday Management LLC, for an undisclosed amount. The acquisition enables Microsoft Corp to enhance its portfolio of software solutions. BlueStripe Software Inc was backed by Valhalla Partners and Trinity Ventures. Following the acquisition, key employees of BlueStripe Software Inc would join Microsoft Corp. BlueStripe Software Inc is located in Morrisville, North Carolina, United States and provides application service management solutions.

100.000%

Not disclosed

* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

August 3, 2015

Deal Description:

Microsoft Corp acquired Incent Games Inc, trading as FantasySalesTeam, a portfolio company of ATX Seed Ventures and Marvel Venture Partners LLC for an undisclosed amount. The acquisition allows Microsoft Corp to increase its growth. Following the transaction, the employees of Incent Games Inc would join Microsoft Corp. Incent Games Inc is located in Austin, Texas, United States and runs online sales contests and fantasy games.
