Mergerstat M & A Database



TARGET: Nokia Oyj /Device & Services Bus/ 
BUYER: Microsoft Corp. 
SELLER: Nokia Oyj



LAST UPDATE: August 26, 2015 
ANNOUNCE DATE: September 2, 2013 
EFFECTIVE DATE: April 25, 2014



DEAL NO.: 764056


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Divestiture - Assets Acquired

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

April 25, 2014

Source of Funds:

Cash

Deal Description:

Microsoft Corp acquired the assets and operations of the device and services businesses of Nokia Oyj for EUR5.4 billion (US$7.2 billion) in cash. Under the terms of the agreement, Microsoft Corp acquired Nokia Oyj's Mobile Phones and Smart Devices business units, which includes the design team, production facilities, sales and marketing units, and related support operations for EUR3.8 billion (US$5 billion). Approximately 32,000 employees would transfer to Microsoft Corp, which includes 4,700 employees in Finland and 18,300 employees within the manufacturing operations worldwide. As part of the transaction, Microsoft Corp acquired Nokia Oyj's patents and licensing agreements for EUR1.7 billion (US$2.2 billion). Microsoft Corp also agreed to provide Nokia Oyj EUR1.5 billion (US$2 billion) worth of financing via three EUR500 million (US$659.3 million) tranches of convertible bonds. The acquisition of the operations and patents are part of Microsoft Corp's strategy to improve its market growth within the mobile device industry. The device and services business of Nokia Oyj is located in Finland, and develops, manufactures and wholesales mobile phones and devices. The operations had net sales of EUR14.9 billion (US$19.6 billion) for the year 2012. The transaction was subject to Nokia Oyj's shareholder approval, regulatory approvals, and customary closing conditions. The deal was originally expected to be completed in the first quarter of 2014. The Boards of Directors of both companies already approved the transaction, and recommended that the shareholders approve the transaction. The Extraordinary General Meeting of Nokia Oyj's shareholders was held on November 19, 2013 to allow shareholders to cast their votes on the transaction. On October 30, 2013, the Competition Commission of India approved the transaction. On November 19, 2013, the said transaction was already approved by the shareholders of Nokia Oyj. On November 21, 2013, Nokia Oyj sought the Delhi High Court's consent to unfreeze the company's immovable assets in India to facilitate the transfer of the production facilities to Microsoft Corp. Nokia Oyj's assets located in India were frozen on September 30, 2013 to ensure that the company has enough funds to pay the tax bill related to the acquisition. On December 2, 2013, the US Federal Trade Commission's Bureau of Competition and the US Department of Justice approved the deal. On December 4, 2013, The European Commission cleared the transaction on the basis that the transaction would not raise any competition concerns. On February 18, 2014, the Competition Commission of South Africa approved the deal. However, on March 14, 2014, the Supreme Court of India dismissed the appeal submitted by Nokia Oyj against the order that required the company to make a deposit to cover for its tax liabilities before transferring its assets in India to Microsoft Corp. On March 24, 2014, Nokia Oyj announced that the transaction remained subject to certain regu

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Closing Offer Price:

$7,174,543,000

Terms:

Available

Method of Payment:

Cash

Cash Payment:

$7,174,543,125

Total Invested Capital:

$7,174,543,000

Base Equity Price:

$7,174,543,125

Transaction Type:

Purpose:

Horizontal

Founded in 2011, VoloMetrix Inc is located in Seattle, Washington, United States and provides enterprise analytics tools.

* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of non-US (foreign) company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

March 19, 2013

Deal Description:

Microsoft Corp acquired Netbreeze GmbH for an undisclosed amount. The transaction enhances Microsoft Corp's portfolio of business intelligence solutions. Following the transaction, Netbreeze GmbH would be integrated in Microsoft Dynamics CRM division. Netbreeze GmbH is located in Dübendorf, Geneve (Geneva), Switzerland and provides internet and online services and business intelligence solutions.

Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Founded in 2013 by Yin Yin Wu and Xuwen Cao, Double Labs Inc is located in Palo Alto, California, United States and develops software for echo notification lock screen.

DEAL NO.: 834708


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Amendment Date:

July 20, 2015

Closing Date:

September 8, 2015

Deal Description:

Microsoft Corp acquired Adallom Inc for a reported value of US$250 million. The transaction accelerates Microsoft Corp's identity management capabilities. Initially on July 20, 2015, rumors surfaced that Microsoft Corp signed a letter of intent to purchase Adallom Inc for US$320 million in cash. Founded in 2012 and counting with 80 employees, Adallom Inc is located in Palo Alto, California, United States and provides seamless, secure and context-aware solutions for SaaS applications.

100.000%

$320,000,000

$320,000,000

DEAL NO.: 842112


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of non-US (foreign) company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

September 28, 2015

Deal Description:

Microsoft Corp acquired Adxstudio Inc for an undisclosed amount. Following the transaction, Adxstudio Inc would operate as Microsoft Corp's professional services division under the Adoxio Business Solutions name. As part of the transaction, all the employees of Adxstudio Inc would remain with the company. Adxstudio Inc is located in Regina, Saskatchewan, Canada and provides web portal and application lifecycle management solutions.

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

November 5, 2015

Deal Description:

Microsoft Corp acquired Mobile Data Labs Inc, a portfolio company of Charles River Ventures Inc, Trinity Ventures LP and SV Angel LLC, for an undisclosed amount. The transaction enhances Microsoft Corp's portfolio of mobile application business. Founded in 2013 by Dan Bomze and Chuck Dietrich, Mobile Data Labs Inc is located in San Francisco, California, United States and provides mileage-tracking mobile application.

DEAL NO.: 847378


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of non-US (foreign) company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Deal Description:

Microsoft Corp agreed to acquire Secure Islands Technologies Ltd, a portfolio company of Van Leer Technology Ventures Jerusalem Ltd and Docor International Management Ltd, for an undisclosed amount. The transaction is reportedly valued between ILS302 million (US$77 million) and ILS588.3 million (US$150 million). The transaction enhances Microsoft Corp's portfolio of products and software solutions offerings. The transaction is subject to regulatory approval and other customary closing conditions. Secure Islands Technologies Ltd is located in Beit-Dagan, HaMerkaz, Israel and develops and markets information protection and control solutions.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Original Offer Price:

$149,761,000

Terms:

Available

Method of Payment:

Cash

$149,761,355

$149,761,000

$149,761,355

* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

October 2, 2015

Deal Description:

Microsoft Corp acquired Telekinesys Research Ltd, doing business as Havok from Intel Corp for an undisclosed amount. The deal allows Microsoft Corp in creation of new gaming software and also continues to be an innovative developer of existing tools of Microsoft Corp. Founded in 1998, Telekinesys Research Ltd is located in Dublin, Dublin, Ireland and provides interactive software and services.

DEAL NO.: 852596


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

December 21, 2015

Deal Description:

Microsoft Corp acquired Talko Inc, a portfolio company of Greylock Management Corp, Kapor Capital and AH Capital Management LLC, for an undisclosed amount. The transaction would enhance Microsoft Corp's service offerings. Following the transaction, Talko Inc's team would join Skype Inc, a subsidiary of Microsoft Corp. Founded in 2014, by Ray Ozzie, Talko Inc is located in Manchester, Massachusetts, United States and develops cloud based software for social interaction.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

DEAL NO.: 857656


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of non-US (foreign) company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

February 3, 2016

Deal Description:

Microsoft Corp acquired TouchType Ltd, trading as Swiftkey, a portfolio company of Octopus Ventures Ltd, Cambridge Capital Group, Accel Partners LLC, Index Ventures SA for an undisclosed amount. The transaction is reported to be valued at GBP 173.2 million (US$250 million). The acquisition would enhance the Microsoft Corp's market for Android and iOS software. TouchType Ltd is located in London, Greater London, United Kingdom and develops application that replaces the on-screen keyboard of the mobile phone.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Closing Offer Price:

$252,707,000

Terms:

Available

Method of Payment:

Cash

$252,707,461

$252,707,000

$252,707,461

EFFECTIVE DATE: June 11, 1996



DEAL NO.: 2334


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

June 11, 1996

Deal Description:

This acquisition continues Microsofts new strategy of buying small companies to acquire new technologies, as opposed to the longer process of internally developing them

Transaction Notes:

Sources close to the deal estimate its value at just below $50 million

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

August 5, 1997

Deal Description:

Microsoft acquired VXreme Inc for an undisclosed amount. The transaction marries Microsofts marketing expertise and strong development framework with cutting-edge streaming media technology from VXtreme.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

DEAL NO.: 32383


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

August 25, 1998

Source of Funds:

Vendor Placing

Deal Description:

Microsoft acquired Valence Research for $7 million in stock. The Valence software will be included in Mircrosofts Windows NT software for computer networks.

Transaction Notes:

BE = 63,600 issued shares * $110.38 per share. (Src Fix-It: Stock)

Equity Consideration:

$63,600

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Original Offer Price:

$7,020,000

Closing Offer Price:

$7,020,000

Terms:

Available

Method of Payment:

Stock

Stock Payment:

$7,020,000

Total Invested Capital:

$7,020,000

Base Equity Price:

$7,020,000

Acquisition

Purpose:

Cancelled Date:

May 20, 1999

Deal Description:

Microsoft cancelled its agreement to acquire 27% of WebMd for $300 million to gain entry into health-care information industry via the Internet.

Percent Sought:

27.000%

Original Offer Price:

$300,000,000

Terms:

* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

December 31, 1997

Source of Funds:

Vendor Placing

Deal Description:

Microsoft Corp acquired Hotmail Corp for undisclosed terms. Hotmail will become an important component of the Microsoft Network of on-line communication and information services that Microsoft offers free to all Internet users.

Transaction Notes:

S-3 2/10/99. 2,769,148 shares of common stock valued at $434 million were registered in connection with the acquisition of Hotmail and Flash Communications based on the average of the high and low prices. (Src Fix-It: Stock)

DEAL NO.: 47913


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

March 16, 2000

Deal Description:

HomeAdvisor Technologies, a majority owned company of Microsoft, acquired Tuttle Decision Systems. The acquisition enables HomeAdvisor to link data capture, decisioning, and underwriting engines and third-party providers to mortgage pricing conduits in the secondary loan market.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

DEAL NO.: 20819


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

August 1, 1997

Source of Funds:

Cash, Vendor Placing

Deal Description:

Microsoft acquired WebTV Networks underscoring its strategy of delivering the benefits of the Internet along with digital broadcasting. Microsoft wrote off $296 million in in-process technology in the first quarter of 1998 in relation to the acquisition.

Transaction Notes:

(Src Fix-It: Combo)

100.000%

Copyright 2001 FactSet Mergerstat, LLC 
Mergerstat M & A Database



TARGET: Stnc Ltd 
BUYER: Microsoft Corp. 
SELLER: Stnc Ltd



LAST UPDATE: March 25, 2001 
ANNOUNCE DATE: July 21, 1999 
EFFECTIVE DATE: July 21, 1999



DEAL NO.: 40772


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of non-US (foreign) company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

July 21, 1999

Deal Description:

Microsoft Corporation, the US computer software company, acquired STNC Enterprises, Bury St Edmunds, Suffolk, England, a communication development software company. STNCs products include a wide range of wireless communications software based on Internet standards and designed for use in small mobile appliances such as cellular telephones and handheld computers. The business was founded in 1993 by Ran Mokady and his wife Amy. 3i the venture capital group, also held a minority stake in the business. STNC will be incorporated into Microsofts productivity appliances division, of which Ran Mokady will become a director. Terms not disclosed. This is Microsofts latest effort to enter the market for products that enable mobile phones to offer Internet access and other data services.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * TARGET DETAILS * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * *

Name:

Stnc Ltd

Computer Software, Supplies & Services

DEAL NO.: 50204


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

October 3, 2000

Source of Funds:

Vendor Placing

Deal Description:

Carpoint, a subsidiary of Microsoft, acquired DriveOff.com from Navidec for $135 million in stock. Navidec is trying to focus on its core competencies. This sale results in a third quarter gain of approximately $45 million to Navidec or approximately $4.02 per share.

Transaction Notes:

Closed BTA.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Original Offer Price:

$135,000,000

Closing Offer Price:

$135,000,000

Terms:

Available

Method of Payment:

Stock

$135,000,000

Total Invested Capital:

$135,000,000

$135,000,000

Acquisition

SELLER: Microsoft Corp.



LAST UPDATE: February 24, 2004 
ANNOUNCE DATE: November 4, 2003 
EFFECTIVE DATE: November 4, 2003



DEAL NO.: 232808


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

November 4, 2003

Source of Funds:

Cash

Deal Description:

Northgate Information Solutions PLC acquired PWA Group Ltd from Great Plains Software Inc, a subsidiary of Microsoft Corp, for GB£2.5 million (approximately US$4.2 million) in cash. The deal further strengthens Northgate Information Solutions PLC market position, widening its HR software offer into the SME market. Northgate Information Solutions PLC also expects this acquisition to be earnings enhancing in the first full year of ownership, before amortization of goodwill and exceptional items.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Original Offer Price:

$4,242,000

Closing Offer Price:

$4,242,000

Terms:

Available

Method of Payment:

Cash

Cash Payment:

$4,242,375

Total Invested Capital:

$4,242,000

Base Equity Price:

$4,242,000

* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

April 26, 2004

Deal Description:

Microsoft Corp acquired ActiveViews Inc for an undisclosed price. With the addition of the ActiveViews Inc technology, SQL Server, a part of Windows Server System, will enable better access to information for every employee at every level in a company, increasing their ability to make more-knowledgeable decisions.

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

July 16, 2004

Microsoft Corp acquired Lookout Software for an undisclosed price. At the completion of the transaction, Microsoft Corp will integrate the business into its MSN network, enabling users to access faster searching for e-mail, files and desktop data within Outlook.

* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

August 11, 2004

Deal Description:

Microsoft Corp acquired Gigacode operating division from Gigaflops Japan Inc, a subsidiary of Cybird Co Ltd, for an undisclosed amount. Gigaflops Japan Inc operates two online information retrieval sites for mobile phone, and Gigacode is one of them. The transaction is a part of Microsoft Corp and Cybird Co Ltd's strategic tie-up plan on contents service.

Deal Type:

Transaction Type:

Purpose:

Conglomerate

Closing Date:

July 14, 1999

Deal Description:

Microsoft Corp., a US computer software company, acquired a 23.7% stake in Telewest Communications Plc, Woking, Surrey, England, the telecommunications group, from MediaOne of the US. TARGET: Navision India Ltd. 
BUYER: Microsoft Corp. / Microsoft Corp. (India) Pvt Ltd. 
SELLER: Navision India Ltd.



LAST UPDATE: March 2, 2005 
ANNOUNCE DATE: February 25, 2005 
EFFECTIVE DATE: February 25, 2005



DEAL NO.: 329714


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of non-US (foreign) company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

February 25, 2005

Source of Funds:

Mezzanine

Deal Description:

Microsoft Corp India Pvt Ltd, a subsidiary of Microsoft Corp, acquired Navision India Ltd for an undisclosed amount. Navision India is a Haryana based provider and distributor of enterprise software. The acquisition will allow Microsoft Business Solutions, Microsoft Corp's enterprise software division, to access the target's 200 customers and more than 50 partners. Furthermore, the software giant have accesses to India's small and mid-sized businesses, which is considered a high-growth segment.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

TARGET: Shenzhen Municipality Tsinghua Shenxun Sci & Tech Dev Co. Ltd. 
BUYER: Microsoft Corp. 
SELLER: Shenzhen Municipality Tsinghua Shenxun Sci & Tech Dev Co. Ltd.



LAST UPDATE: May 17, 2005 
ANNOUNCE DATE: May 12, 2005 
EFFECTIVE DATE: May 12, 2005



DEAL NO.: 337375


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of non-US (foreign) company - Assets Acquired

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

May 12, 2005

Deal Description:

Microsoft Corp, the US-listed window-based software giant, acquired certain assets of Shenzhen Municipality Tsinghua Shenxun Science & Technology Development Co Ltd for an undisclosed amount. Shenzhen Municipality Tsinghua Shenxun principally engages in the provision of mobile software and services in China. The transaction marks the first time Microsoft enter into an acquisition agreement with a company in China involving mobile Internet services. Concurrent to the acquisition, Microsoft also signed an agreement with Shanghai Alliance Investment Ltd to form Shanghai MSN Network Communications Technology Co Ltd to operate a nationwide Internet information service business in the country. The joint venture will operate a Chinese version of the MSN Portal and various MSN-branded instant messaging, web email and search services.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * TARGET DETAILS * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * *

Name:

Shenzhen Municipality Tsinghua Shenxun Sci & Tech Dev Co. Ltd.

Country:

China

Industry:

Internet; Computer Software, Supplies & Services

Description:

Develops and provides mobile software and content services

TARGET: Teleo, Inc. 
BUYER: Microsoft Corp. 
SELLER: Teleo, Inc.



LAST UPDATE: August 31, 2005 
ANNOUNCE DATE: August 30, 2005 
EFFECTIVE DATE: August 30, 2005



DEAL NO.: 347961


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

August 30, 2005

Deal Description:

Microsoft Corp acquired Teleo Inc, a provider of voice over Internet protocol (VoIP) software and services, for an undisclosed price. Teleo, founded in 2003 and headquartered in San Francisco, California, develops software that enable the placement of phone calls from PCs to traditional phones and that deliver this technology in unique ways through a variety of software and Web applications. Microsoft expects to integrate this technology with the existing VoIP investments of MSN to further develop products and services that connect consumers to the people and information. The financial details were not disclosed.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * TARGET DETAILS * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * *

Name:

Teleo, Inc.

Country:

United States

Industry:

Internet; Computer Software, Supplies & Services

Description:

Provides voice over Internet protocol (VoIP) software and services

TARGET: ZTEsoft Co. Ltd. 
BUYER: Microsoft Corp. 
SELLER: ZTEsoft Co. Ltd.



LAST UPDATE: September 2, 2005 
ANNOUNCE DATE: September 2, 2005 
EFFECTIVE DATE: September 2, 2005



DEAL NO.: 348227


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture Minority Interest

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

September 2, 2005

Deal Description:

Microsoft Corp, a world-leading software conglomerate, acquired a 10.0% minority stake in ZTEsoft Co Ltd for approximately RMB 40.5 million (US$ 5.0 million). Founded in December, 2003, Nanjing-based ZTEsoft is a joint venture created by ZTE and Accenture of the United States. ZTEsoft develops distributes and supports business solution software; the firm realized a profit of RMB 20.0 million (US$ 2.5 million) in 2004. This acquisition will allow Microsoft to get directly involved in the marketing of Chinese software market instead of research and development only.

Percent Sought:

10.000%

Original Offer Price:

$5,000,000

Closing Offer Price:

$5,000,000

Terms:

Available

Total Invested Capital:

$5,000,000

Base Equity Price:

$5,000,000

ZTEsoft Co. Ltd.

Country:

China

Develops distributes and supports business solution software

TARGET: IT Agent Corp. 
BUYER: Plaza Create Co., Ltd. 
SELLER: Microsoft Corp.



LAST UPDATE: September 12, 2005 
ANNOUNCE DATE: September 9, 2005 
EFFECTIVE DATE: September 12, 2005



DEAL NO.: 348932


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Conglomerate

Closing Date:

September 12, 2005

Deal Description:

Plaza Create Co Ltd, a Tokyo based photo developer, acquired an additional 5% stake of IT Agent Corp from Microsoft Corp for an undisclosed amount. In a series of related transactions, Plaza Create acquired the remaining 95% stake of the target from Daiwabo Co Ltd, Itochu Corp, Shinkin Banks Information System Center Co Ltd, Future System Consulting Corp and from a minority investor. Although individual transaction values were not given, in total, Plaza Create paid approximately JPY50 million (US$0.4 million) for a 100% stake in IT Agent. The target is a Tokyo based company that designs and operates eCommerce Websites. The company recorded a net loss of JPY275 million (US$2.5 million) on sales of JPY1.6 billion (US$14.1 million) for the fiscal year that ended on March 31, 2005. The acquisition will allow Plaza Create to strengthen its Internet-related businesses.

Percent Owned Before:

93.000%

Percent Sought:

5.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * TARGET DETAILS * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * *

Name:

IT Agent Corp.

Country:

Japan

Industry:

Internet; Computer Software, Supplies & Services

Description:

Provides the development and management of eCommerce websites

TARGET: media-streams.com AG 
BUYER: Microsoft Corp. 
SELLER: media-streams.com AG



LAST UPDATE: November 3, 2005 
ANNOUNCE DATE: November 3, 2005 
EFFECTIVE DATE: November 3, 2005



DEAL NO.: 354534


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of non-US (foreign) company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

November 3, 2005

Deal Description:

US-based software company Microsoft Corp acquired media-streamscom AG for an undisclosed price. Located in Zurich, Switzerland, media-streamscom AG also develops software. The company specializes in communications applications based on Voice over Internet Protocol (VoIP) technology. In a statement, Microsoft Corp said that the acquisition of media-streams.com AG will allow Microsoft to offer increased VoIP capabilities as an integral part of its Office System applications and servers - specifically its Real-Time Collaboration platform.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

DEAL NO.: 323340


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

January 14, 2005

Deal Description:

Washington Post Co acquired Slate Magazine from Microsoft Corp for an undisclosed price. Jacob Weisberg will remain editor of Slate. The company said its online-publishing unit, Washingtonpost. Newsweek Interactive, will run the business operations of Slate, which will continue to operate offices in New York and Washington, DC.

Transaction Notes:

Closed by MM.

100.000%

Not disclosed

DEAL NO.: 273262


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

March 15, 2005

Deal Description:

Microsoft acquired an additional stake in Contentguard Inc for an undisclosed price. At the completion of the transaction, Microsoft will hold a 33.3% stake in the company. The proceeds from this transaction will be used for working capital purposes. In addition, Time Warner acquired a minority stake in the company. The partnership between the companies will enable for the development of digital distribution and DRM solutions.

Percent Owned Before:

-1.000%

Percent Sought:

-1.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

TARGET: MSNBC Cable LLC 
BUYER: General Electric Co. / NBC Universal, Inc. 
SELLER: Microsoft Corp.



LAST UPDATE: December 23, 2005 
ANNOUNCE DATE: December 23, 2005 
EFFECTIVE DATE: December 23, 2005



DEAL NO.: 359644


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

December 23, 2005

Deal Description:

NBC Universal Inc, a subsidiary of General Electric Co, acquired a controlling stake in MSNBC Cable LLC from Microsoft Corp for an undisclosed price. MSNBC Cable LLC was started as a joint venture between NBC Universal Inc and Microsoft Corp. MSNBC Cable LLC specializes in broadcasting news via cable-news channel MSNBC. NBC Universal Inc has the option within two years to acquire a 100% control of the channel.

Percent Sought:

-1.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

TARGET: FrontBridge Technologies, Inc.

LAST UPDATE: December 27, 2005 
ANNOUNCE DATE: July 20, 2005 
EFFECTIVE DATE: August 31, 2005



DEAL NO.: 343784


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

August 31, 2005

Deal Description:

Microsoft Corp acquired FrontBridge Technologies Inc, a leading provider of managed services that address corporate e-mail security, compliance and availability requirements, for an undisclosed price. This acquisition allows Microsoft to deliver a service for enforcing compliance through archiving, minimizing spam and viruses, and ensuring e-mail availability in the case of a disaster. FrontBridge's scalable service-delivery model can be applied to organizations using other SMTP-compliant e-mail servers, requires no upfront capital investment and minimizes IT management overhead, which allow companies to concentrate their scarce IT resources on areas that most directly impact their business, such as driving innovation, building efficiencies and increasing customer satisfaction.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * TARGET DETAILS * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * *

Name:

FrontBridge Technologies, Inc.

Country:

United States

Industry:

Internet; Computer Software, Supplies & Services

Description:

Provides email protection and secure messaging solutions to businesses worldwide

TARGET: UMT 
BUYER: Microsoft Corp. 
SELLER: UMT



LAST UPDATE: January 19, 2006 
ANNOUNCE DATE: December 16, 2005 
EFFECTIVE DATE: January 19, 2006



DEAL NO.: 358773


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company - Assets Acquired

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

January 19, 2006

Deal Description:

Microsoft Corp acquired the business assets of software developer UMT. Financial terms of the deal were not disclosed. Headquartered in New York, UMT develops portfolio management software compatible with the existing Microsoft Office Enterprise Project Management suite. Microsoft intends to integrate the acquired assets into the office suite, and some UMT executives and a number of UMT product development employees will join the Redmond-based Office project team. The implementation consulting arm of UMT will continue as UMT Consulting Group, a separate entity that provides support services for the Microsoft portfolio management software platform.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * TARGET DETAILS * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * *

Name:

UMT

Country:

United States

Industry:

Internet; Computer Software, Supplies & Services

Description:

Offers portfolio management software and implementation consulting services

TARGET: Geotango International Corp. 
BUYER: Microsoft Corp. 
SELLER: Geotango International Corp.



LAST UPDATE: January 23, 2006 
ANNOUNCE DATE: December 23, 2005 
EFFECTIVE DATE: December 23, 2005



DEAL NO.: 362361


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of non-US (foreign) company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

December 23, 2005

Deal Description:

Microsoft Corp, a developer and distributor of a wide range of software products, acquired Toronto-based Geotango International Corp, a private company that provides two and three-dimensional mapping, modeling, and analysis services via the Internet, for an undisclosed amount. The products of Geotango will be integrated with Microsoft's products over time. The products of Geotango include its Geotango GlobeView(TM) that provides three-dimensional images of the cities and countries of the globe; and its SilverEye(TM) product that builds three-dimensional models of urban centers and related facilities. The acquisition of Geotango will enable Microsoft to develop advanced mapping and visualization framework products.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * TARGET DETAILS * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * *

Name:

Geotango International Corp.

Country:

Canada

Industry:

Internet; Construction Contractors & Engineering Services

Description:

Provides three-dimensional and two-dimensional mapping, visualization, modeling and geographical analysis accessible via Internet

DEAL NO.: 367118


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

March 8, 2006

Deal Description:

Microsoft Corp acquired Onfolio Inc for an undisclosed price. The software solutions developed by Onfolio Inc will become part of the Windows Live toolbar, in an effort for Microsoft Corp to better compete with Google. Onfolio Inc employs a staff of seven employees, all of whome will relocate to the Redmond, Washington location of Microsoft Corp.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

DEAL NO.: 370505


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of non-US (foreign) company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

April 6, 2006

Deal Description:

Microsoft Game Studios, a subsidiary of Microsoft Corp, acquired Lionhead Studios Ltd for an undisclosed amount. Based in the UK, Lionhead Studios Ltd develops video games including the "Fable" series that has gone to sell over 2 million copies worldwide. Lionhead Studios Ltd will immediately begin creating content exclusively for the Xbox 360 and Microsoft Windows platforms.

* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

May 5, 2006

Deal Description:

Microsoft Corp acquired Vexcel Corp for an undisclosed price. The acquisition stems from the strategy of Microsoft Corp to further develop and provide digital representation of the real world that provides the best local search and mapping experience. Vexcel Corp employs a staff of 130 people.

Transaction Type:

Purpose:

Vertical

June 8, 2006

Under the terms of agreement, Skinkers will have access to technology from Microsoft Research Lab Cambridge that will enable Skinkers to develop its product. The acquisition will allow Skinkers to create the product with Microsoft incorporating it as part of its product line.

DEAL NO.: 168452


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition Tender Offer

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of non-US (foreign) company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

July 11, 2002

Source of Funds:

Cash, Vendor Placing

Deal Description:

Microsoft Corp acquired Navision AS in a tender offer for DKK 11 billion (US $1.3 billion) in cash and stock. The integration of the business strategies and products offerings of Navision AS provides growth opportunities for Microsoft Corp, particularly in the small and mid-markets. Navision AS will become part of the business solutions division of Microsoft Corp.

Transaction Notes:

BE = 36,040,000 NAVI DC o/s * DKK $300 combined offer price of cash and stock per share. Advisor list, KW.

$27,026,756

Premium Offered:

0.132

100.000%

$36.914

$1,330,373,000

$1,330,373,000

68.236

10.596

Available

$-1,000,000

TARGET: Azyxxi 
BUYER: Microsoft Corp. 
SELLER: Azyxxi



LAST UPDATE: November 3, 2006 
ANNOUNCE DATE: July 26, 2006 
EFFECTIVE DATE: July 26, 2006



DEAL NO.: 381936


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

July 26, 2006

Deal Description:

Microsoft Corp acquired Azyxxi for an undisclosed price. Azyxxi develops software for hospitals and doctors to track medical records electronically. Azyxxi's software is built on Microsoft development tools and gives doctors real-time access to patient data from existing systems.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

TARGET: MotionBridge SA 
BUYER: Microsoft Corp. 
SELLER: Siemens Acceleration In Communications Gmbh



LAST UPDATE: December 4, 2006 
ANNOUNCE DATE: February 13, 2006 
EFFECTIVE DATE: February 13, 2006



DEAL NO.: 364599


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

February 13, 2006

Deal Description:

Microsoft Corp acquired the entire share capital of MotionBridge SA for an undisclosed amount. The acquisition will allow Microsoft Corp to combine the mobile search solutions of MotionBridge SA with its mobile networks, creating better services for its current users. MotionBridge SA is based in Paris, France and was providing mobile search technology through contacts with major mobile communications companies in Europe and North America.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * TARGET DETAILS * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * *

Name:

MotionBridge SA

Country:

France

Industry:

Internet; Computer Software, Supplies & Services

Description:

Provides research technology designed specifically for mobile operators and the mobile Internet

TARGET: DesktopStandard Corp. 
BUYER: Microsoft Corp. 
SELLER: DesktopStandard Corp.



LAST UPDATE: December 12, 2006 
ANNOUNCE DATE: October 2, 2006 
EFFECTIVE DATE: October 2, 2006



DEAL NO.: 392049


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

October 2, 2006

Deal Description:

Microsoft Corp acquired DesktopStandard Corp for an undisclosed amount. The acquisition enhances Microsoft Corp's ability to meet customers' needs to perform Group Policy lifecycle management, consolidate the number of policy objects being managed, and increase desktop management functionality. DesktopStandard Corp develops policy-based enterprise desktop management products.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * TARGET DETAILS * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * *

Name:

DesktopStandard Corp.

Country:

United States

Industry:

Internet; Computer Software, Supplies & Services

Description:

Develops policy-based enterprise desktop management products

TARGET: Road Runner LLC 
BUYER: Compaq Computer Corp. / Advance/Newhouse Communications, Inc. / Time Warner, Inc. /Old/ 
SELLER: Microsoft Corp.



LAST UPDATE: March 21, 2007 
ANNOUNCE DATE: December 18, 2000 
EFFECTIVE DATE: December 18, 2000



DEAL NO.: 136037


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Unit Minority

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

December 18, 2000

Source of Funds:

Cash

Deal Description:

Time Warner Inc acquired 10% interest in Road Runner owned by Microsoft Corp for an undisclosed amount of cash. Road Runner is a joint venture, formed from affiliates of Time Warner Inc, MediaOne Group Inc, Microsoft Corp, Compaq Corp, and Advance/Newhouse Communications. In June of 2000, AT&T acquired MediaOne and assumed its ownership interest in Road Runner. The deal is expected to close April 30, 2001.

Percent Sought:

10.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

Method of Payment:

Cash

Cash Payment:

$-1,000,000

LAST UPDATE: March 28, 2007 
ANNOUNCE DATE: March 26, 2007 
EFFECTIVE DATE: March 26, 2007



DEAL NO.: 416100


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

March 26, 2007

Deal Description:

Microsoft Corp acquired devBiz Business Solutions LLC for an undisclosed amount. Microsoft intends to embed the devBiz web client into Visual Studio Team System (VSTS) for the next release of Visual Studio, which has been code-named Orcas. devBiz develops software tools and components for professional .NET developers.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

DEAL NO.: 421795


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

May 11, 2007

Deal Description:

MacDonald Dettwiler & Associates Ltd acquired Vexcel Canada Inc from Microsoft Corp for an undisclosed amount. The acquisition of Vexcel Canada allows MacDonald Dettwiler & Associates Ltd to more rapidly enter the market for new applications and enhance their geospatial services business. Vexcel Canada Inc provides products and services using radar image data sources.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

June 4, 2007

Deal Description:

Microsoft Corp acquired Engyro Corp, based in Cincinnati, Ohio, for an undisclosed amount. Engyro Corp provides software solutions for IT operations. The acquisition enables Microsoft Corp to expand its service offerings for interoperable enterprise solutions.

TARGET: Stratature, Inc. 
BUYER: Microsoft Corp. 
SELLER: Stratature, Inc.



LAST UPDATE: June 8, 2007 
ANNOUNCE DATE: June 7, 2007 
EFFECTIVE DATE: June 7, 2007



DEAL NO.: 425762


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

June 7, 2007

Deal Description:

Microsoft Corp acquired Stratature Inc for an undisclosed price. The acquisition stems from the strategy of Microsoft Corp to build master data management tools into its Office System line. The move complements the company's strategy to bulk up the business intelligence tools in Office and SQL Server.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * TARGET DETAILS * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * *

Name:

Stratature, Inc.

Country:

United States

LAST UPDATE: July 9, 2007 
ANNOUNCE DATE: May 23, 2006 
EFFECTIVE DATE: July 17, 2006



DEAL NO.: 375464


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

July 17, 2006

Deal Description:

Microsoft Corp acquired Softricity Inc for an undisclosed amount. Boston-based Softricity Inc offers the SoftGrid Desktop Virtualization Platform which provides Windows customers the ability to turn almost all Windows applications into a service using application virtualization and streaming software technologies. Softricity Inc has disclosed $63 million in funding from Prism Venture Partners, FA Technology Ventures, and several other investors since its launch in 1999.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of non-US (foreign) company

Purpose:

Closing Date:

October 29, 2007

Deal Description:

Earlier in 2007, Microsoft also bought a company that develops Web search technology for medical information and launched a website to store medical information online.

DEAL NO.: 420693


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

September 14, 2007

Deal Description:

Microsoft Corp acquired ScreenTonic SA for an undisclosed amount. ScreenTonic SA provides mobile digital advertising services. The acquisition is in line with Microsoft Corp's strategy to deliver ad experiences that map to the environment. ScreenTonic SA will continue to operate independently from its offices in Paris, France. Microsoft Corp plans to utilize ScreenTonic SA's business operations with its Microsoft Digital Advertising Solutions.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

TARGET: Chinasoft International Ltd.

LAST UPDATE: April 12, 2008 
ANNOUNCE DATE: September 27, 2005 
EFFECTIVE DATE: May 31, 2006



DEAL NO.: 351448


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture Minority Interest

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

May 31, 2006

Source of Funds:

Cash

Deal Description:

Microsoft Corp, a US-based public software developer, has acquired an undisclosed minority stake in Chinasoft International Ltd for an approximate cash amount of RMB162 million (US$20 million). Chinasoft International is a China-based public company and it principally provides enterprise applications software and IT consulting services. In a separate but related transaction, International Finance Corp, a US-based investment arm of The World Bank Group, signed an agreement to acquire an undisclosed minority stake in Chinasoft International Ltd concurrently.

Percent Sought:

-1.000%

Original Offer Price:

$20,013,000

Closing Offer Price:

$20,199,000

Terms:

Available

Method of Payment:

Cash

Cash Payment:

$20,199,044

Total Invested Capital:

$20,013,000

Base Equity Price:

$20,199,000

Deal Type:

Unit Minority

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Vertical

Closing Date:

March 15, 2005

Deal Description:

Thomson SA acquired a 33% minority interest in ContentGuard Inc for an undisclosed amount. ContentGuard Inc, based in Bethesda, Maryland, produces digital content software solutions. Thomson SA said that the stake was sold by Microsoft Corp, Time Warner Inc, and Xerox Corp. Further details of the transaction were not disclosed.

Percent Sought:

33.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

DEAL NO.: 330577


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

June 30, 2005

Deal Description:

Microsoft Corp acquired the remaining interest in Groove Networks Inc for an undisclosed price. Microsoft Corp made this acquisition to complement its SharePoint operations, its own collaboration program and Web portal that is designed to run over internal corporate networks and the Internet. The transaction is expected to be competed by the second quarter of 2005.

Copyright 2008 FactSet Mergerstat, LLC 
Mergerstat M & A Database



TARGET: Alacris, Inc. 
BUYER: Microsoft Corp. 
SELLER: Alacris, Inc.



LAST UPDATE: May 13, 2008 
ANNOUNCE DATE: September 19, 2005 
EFFECTIVE DATE: September 19, 2005



DEAL NO.: 349720


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of non-US (foreign) company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

September 19, 2005

Deal Description:

Microsoft Corp, a public company that develops, sells, and invests in software products, acquired Alacris Inc, a private software company that develops and provides identity, access management solutions, and related smart card products, for an undisclosed amount. According to Corporate VP of Security Technology Unit at Microsoft, Mr. Mike Nash, "Through this acquisition, we're excited to gain technology that makes it easier for customers to take advantage of the smart card capabilities in Windows(R) with tools to simplify smart card life-cycle management." Mr. Ron Mac Donell, President and CEO of Alacris stated that the technology of Alacris will become part of Microsoft's security product offerings, which will give Alacris a larger consumer base. Alacris is known for providing digital certificate and products for authentication purposes.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * TARGET DETAILS * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * *

Name:

Alacris, Inc.

Country:

Canada

Industry:

Internet; Computer Software, Supplies & Services

Description:

Provides certificate management and identity assurance software products
